msgSnippet: ... This sounds odd to me. If all you re doing is checking the /type/ of the exception, then why would a subclass matter? Do you have an example of where this
messageBody:
Ben Maurer wrote:

> When writing a test, I usually want to make sure the program throws
> the *EXACT* type of exception I specify, not that it throws some
> random subclass.

This sounds odd to me. If all you're doing is checking the /type/ of the
exception, then why would a subclass matter? Do you have an example of
where this causes trouble? (I'm sure you do, otherwise you wouldn't have
brought this up--I guess this just bit you in the ass today.)

This is why I often don't just want to check the exception type, but
rather the instance; which is why the short-form exception test isn't
something I get to enjoy.
